title: Ticket #5153: Add Travis CI yaml file
description:
I'd like to add a .travis.yml file to the repository root. This provides support for http://travis-ci.org, a continuous integration product that's tightly integrated with Github.

Wait - you ask - don't we already have a CI product? Travis CI itself is actually fairly limited - single platform, fairly limited amount of max build time, no separate testing phase from build. It is no batlab!

However, it has one killer feature missing from batlab: ability for unauthenticated users to trigger builds for arbitrary code. The platform is container-based if sudo is unnecessary for building and VM-based otherwise.

Relative to the number of people with github accounts, batlab users are rare. Allowing us to do clipped builds from arbitrary patches should help ease the pain of contribution (both for the contributors and the patch reviewers) from folks outside the core team. We could check the results of the build from any newcomer before we start taking a close look. This would be completely optional; I propose no changes to the contribution process.

I propose adding a minimal clipped build to enable support. Other than adding a file to our repo, there's no other action needed.
